dialogues.HOPPS:
[1]Thank you! 
[2]Oh hi, I'm Judy! Your new neighbor! 
[3]Greasy walls... rickety bed... 
[4]Crazy neighbors... I love it! 
[5]Scuse me! Down here? Hi. 
[6]Ooo, uh, you probably didn't know, but a bunny can call another bunny "cute," but when other animals do it, it's a little... 
[7]It's okay-- oh, you've actually you've actually got a-- there's a-- in your neck-- the fold-- the-- there's-- 
[8]I should get to roll call, so... which way do I? 
[9]Great, thank you! 
[10]Hey. Officer Hopps. You ready to make the world a better place? 
[11]Parking duty? Uh, Chief? Chief Bogo? 
[12]Sir, you said there were 14 missing mammal cases? 
[13]So I can handle one. You probably forgot, but I was top of my class at the academy. 
[14]Sir, I'm not just some "token" bunny. 
[15]100 tickets...? I'm not gonna write 100 tickets... I'm gonna write 200 tickets! 
[16]Before noon! 
[17]Boom! 200 tickets before noon. 
[18]201. 
[19]Where'd he go... 
[20]I'm such a... 
[21]Hello? Excuse me? 
[22]Actually... I'm an officer. Just had a quick question. Are your customers aware they're getting snot and mucous with their cookies and cream? 
[23]Well, I don't wanna cause you any trouble, but I believe scooping ice cream with an un-gloved trunk is a Class 3 Health Code Violation... 
[24]...Which is kind of a big deal. Of course-- I could let you off with a warning if you were to glove those trunks and, I don't know, finish selling this nice dad and his son a... what was it? 
[25]A Jumbo Pop. 
[26]Keep the change. 
[27]Oh no, my treat-- it just-- y'know, it burns me up to see folks with such backward attitudes toward foxes. I just wanna say, you're a great dad and just a... a real articulate fella. 
[28]Hopps. Mr... 
[29]And you little guy, you want to be an elephant when you grow up... you be an elephant-- because this is Zootopia, anyone can be anything. 
[30]Toot, toot! 
[31]Goodbye! 
[32]Oh! Hey, little toot toot-- 
[33]Well. I stood up for you, and you lied to me. You liar! 
[34]Hey! 
[35]Alright, slick Nick, you're under arrest. 
[36]Gee I don't know, how `bout selling food without a permit, transporting undeclared commerce across borough lines, false advertising... 
[37]You told that mouse the popsicle sticks were redwood! 
[38]You're gonna wanna refrain from calling me Carrots... 
[39]Ah, no. Podunk is in Deerbrooke County, and I grew up in Bunnyburrow. 
[40]Hey! Hey! No one tells me what I can or can't be! Especially not some jerk who never had the guts to try to be anything more than a popsicle hustler! 
[41]I am NOT a dumb bunny. 
[42]Oh hey, it's my parents! 
[43]It was real great. 
[44]Mmm. Absolutely. And more. Everyone's so nice. And I feel like I'm really making a difference-- 
[45]Oh this? No! Oh, no no! This is just a temporary thing-- 
[46]Dad! Dad-- 
[47]DAD! You know what-- it's been a really long day, I should really-- 
[48]Buh-bye. 
[49]Tomorrow's another day... 
[50]I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop... 
[51]Sir, if you have a grievance, you may contest your citation in traffic court. 
[52]Oh, yes! Yes! Don't worry, sir, I got this! 
[53]Stop! Stop in the name of the law! 
[54]I got dibs! Officer Hopps, I am in pursuit! 
[55]You! Freeze! 
[56]Stop! 
[57]Oh! Oh, sorry! Coming through! `Scuse me! `Scuse me. Pardon... 
[58]Hey! Stop right there! 
[59]I love your hair. 
[60]I popped the weasel! 
[61]Hate to disagree with you, sir, but those aren't onions. Those are a crocus varietal called Midnicampum Holicithias. They're a Class C Botanical, sir. I grew up in a family where plant husbandry was kind of a thing. 
[62]Sir, I got the bad guy. That's my job. 
[63]Sir, I don't want to be a meter maid... I wanna be a real cop. 
[64]But sir, if you-- 
[65]I will find him. 
[66]What? Why?! 
[67]Like glue! 
[68]Thank you, ma'am. 
[69]
[70]Okay. 
[71]Oh, uh... okay... deal. 
[72]That's it?! 
[73]Okay. "Last known sighting..." 
[74]Can I just borrow-- Thank you. 
[75]Pawpsicle. 
[76]Get your pawpsicle... 
[77]It means I... have a lead. 
[78]Hi! Hello? It's me again! 
[79]Ha-ha-ho, no actually it's Officer Hopps, and I'm here to ask you some questions about a case. 
[80]This is important, sir. I think your ten dollars worth of popsicles can wait. 
[81]Please, just look at the picture. 
[82]You sold Mr. Otterton that popsicle right? Do you know him? 
[83]Fine. Then we'll have to do this the hard way. 
[84]Nicholas Wilde, you are under arrest. 
[85]Felony tax evasion. 
[86]Yeah. 200 dollars a day... 365 days a year... since you were 12, that's two decades, so times twenty... 
[87]...which is one million four- hundred sixty thousand-- I think, I mean I am just a dumb bunny, but we are good at multiplying-- anyway, according to your tax forms... ...you reported let me see here: zero. Unfortunately, lying on a federal form is a punishable offense. Five years jail time. 
[88]Actually, it's your word against yours. And if you want this pen, you're going to help me find this poor missing otter or the only place you'll be selling popsicles is the prison cafeteria. It's called a hustle, sweetheart. 
[89]Start talking. 
[90]Great, let's go. 
[91]Don't call me cute. Get in the car. 
[92]Hi, hello. 
[93]Um, hello? Hello? HELLO?! 
[94]Hello! My name is-- 
[95]Uh, no... I'm Officer Hopps, ZPD. I'm looking for a missing mammal, Emmitt Otterton. Right here-- --who may have frequented this establishment. 
[96]Oh, thank you so much, I'd appreciate that more than you can imagine. It would be such a big-- You are naked! 
[97]Yes there is. 
[98]You didn't happen to catch the license plate number, did you? 
[99]0, 3... Wow, this is a lot of great info, thank you. 
[100]The plate... I can't run a plate... I'm not in the system yet. 
[101]What was it you said? "Any moron can run a plate?" Gosh... if only there were a moron around who were up to the task... 
[102]Not forever. Why, I only have 36 hours left to solve this case. So can you run the plate or not? 
[103]I hope so, we are really fighting the clock and every minute counts. Wait. They're all sloths?! 
[104]You said this was going to be quick! 
[105]Officer Judy Hopps, ZPD. How are ya? 
[106]Fine? 
[107]Well, I was hoping you could run a plate-- 
[108]Well, I was hoping you could-- 
[109]Well, I was hoping you could run a plate for us. We are in a really big hurry. 
[110]
[111]
[112]
[113]
[114]
[115]Mmhmm. 0, 3. 
[116]3! 
[117]No! 
[118]Three humped camel. 
[119]Ha, ha, yes very funny, very funny, can we please just focus on the task-- 
[120]Oh no! 
[121]No! 
[122]A three humped camel? Pregnant! Okay, great, we got it, please just- - 
[123]Aggggggghhhhhhh-- 
[124]Yeah, yeah, yeah... thank you! 
[125]29THD03-- it's registered to... Tundratown Limo Service? A limo took Otterton, and the limo's in Tundratown-- it's in Tundratown! 
[126]Hurry, we gotta beat the rush hour and-- 
[127]
[128]Closed. Great. 
[129]You wasted the day on purpose. 
[130]It's not a pretend investigation! Look, see-- See him? This otter is missing. 
[131]What is your problem? Does seeing me fail somehow make you feel better about your own sad, miserable life? 
[132]Fine. We are done. Here's your pen. 
[133]The thing is, you don't need a warrant if you have probable cause, and I'm pretty sure I saw a shifty low-life climbing the fence, so you're helping plenty. Come on. 
[134]29THD03... this is it. 
[135]Polar bear fur. 
[136]What? What?! 
[137]Those are... claw marks. You ever seen anything like this? 
[138]Oh, wait. Look. 
[139]This is him. Emmitt Otterton. He was definitely here. What do you think happened? 
[140]Why? Whose car is it? 
[141]I'm not leaving, this is a crime scene. 
[142]What did you do that made Mr. Big so mad at you? 
[143]Oh, sweet cheese and crackers. 
[144]Is that Mr. Big? 
[145]What about him? Is that him? 
[146]That's gotta be him. 
[147]Sir, I am a c-- 
[148]No. I am a cop. And I'm on the Emmitt Otterton case, and my evidence puts him in your car, so intimidate me all you want, I'm going to find out what you did to that otter if it's the last thing I do. 
[149]Hi. I love your dress. 
[150]Because he was attacked. 
[151]Otterton? 
[152]He's a sweet little otter. 
[153]Mr. Manchas? Judy Hopps, ZPD. We just want to know what happened to Emmitt Otterton. 
[154]What... happened? 
[155]Yep. So, uh, you just open the door and tell us what you know and we will tell you what we know. Okay? 
[156]Clever fox. 
[157]Mr. Manchas? 
[158]Are you... okay? 
[159]Run. RUN! 
[160]I don't know!! 
[161]Jump! 
[162]Head down! 
[163]Officer Hopps to dispatch! 
[164]
[165]Clawhauser, listen to me! We have a 10-91! Jaguar gone savage! Vine and Tu-junja! 
[166]There! Head to the skytrams! 
[167]Go! 
[168]I'm gonna let go! 
[169]One, two-- 
[170]Well. That's what we do at the 
[171]I thought this was just a missing mammal case, but it's way bigger. 
[172]Mr. Otterton did not just disappear. I believe he and this jaguar, they... went savage, Sir. 
[173]I thought so too, `til I saw this: 
[174]What? He was right here... 
[175]Sir, I know what I saw-- he almost killed us. 
[176]Wait-- Sir, I'm not the only one who saw him! Nick! 
[177]Well he was a key witness and I enlisted-- 
[178]But, Sir, we... 
[179]Thank you. 
[180]So, things do get to you... 
[181]Har-har. 
[182]...And two? 
[183]Nick, you are so much more than that... 
[184]Nick, I'm glad you told me... 
[185]Seriously, it's okay... 
[186]The traffic cams would have caught it! 
[187]Pretty sneaky, Slick. 
[188]No... But I have a friend at City Hall who might. 
[189]Assistant Mayor Bellwether? We need your help. 
[190]We just need to get into the traffic cam database. 
[191]Hey! 
[192]You can't just touch a sheep's wool... 
[193]Rainforest District, Vine and Tujunga. 
[194]But you're the Assistant Mayor of Zootopia. 
[195]Shush. Okay, traffic cams... Tujunga, Tujunga... we're in. 
[196]Who are these guys? 
[197]Howlers! Night howlers! That's what Manchas was afraid of... wolves! The wolves are the night howlers. If they took Manchas... 
[198]All we gotta do is find out where they went. 
[199]Wait. Where'd they go? 
[200]Well, look at you, Junior Detective. You know, I think you'd actually make a pretty good cop. 
[201]They're heading out of town... Where does that road go? 
[202]Come on! 
[203]It looks like this was a hospital. 
[204]All this equipment is brand new... 
[205]Claw marks... 
[206]Mr. Manchas. 
[207]It's him. We found our otter. Mr. Otterton, my name is Officer Judy Hopps. Your wife sent me to find you. We're gonna get you out of here now. 
[208]...11, 12, 13, 14. Not including Manchas it's 14... Chief Bogo handed out 14 Missing Mammal files... They're all here. All the missing mammals are right here. 
[209]Can you swim? 
[210]We gotta tell Bogo! 
[211]Mayor Lionheart, you have the right to remain silent. Anything-- 
[212]You were just trying to protect your job. 
[213]You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law... 
[214]Rrrgh. I am so nervous... 
[215]You should be there with me. We did this together. 
[216]Funny you should say that, because I've been thinking... it would be nice to have a partner. 
[217]Here. In case you need something to write with. 
[218]Yes? 
[219]Well, the animals in question... Are they all different species? Yes. Yes they are. 
[220]Well, all we know is that they are all members of the predator family. 
[221]That is accu-- Yes, that is accurate. Yes... 
[222]We still don't know-- 
[223]Ah, it may have something to do with biology. 
[224]A biological component. You know, something in their DNA... 
[225]Yes. What I mean is, thousands of years ago... um... predators survived through their aggressive hunting instincts. For whatever reason, they seem to be reverting back to their primitive, savage ways. 
[226]It is possible. So we must be vigilant. And we at the ZPD are prepared and are here to protect you... 
[227]Was I okay? 
[228]That went so fast! I didn't get a chance to mention you or say anything about how we-- 
[229]What do you mean? 
[230]I just stated the facts of the case. I mean, it's not like a bunny could go savage... 
[231]Nick, stop it. You're not like them. 
[232]You know what I mean. You're not that kind of predator. 
[233]No. Nick. Nick! 
[234]No. He's my friend. 
[235]That is not what I said! Please! 
[236]The Mayor? Why? 
[237]Clawhauser? What're you doing? 
[238]What? 
[239]Um... I don't understand. 
[240]I'm not... I'm not a hero. I came here to make the world a better place, but I think I broke it. 
[241]With all due respect, sir, a good cop is supposed to serve and protect-- help the city. Not tear it apart. I don't deserve this badge. 
[242]Thank you for the opportunity. 
[243]A dozen carrots. 
[244]Have a nice day. 
[245]Why did I think I could make a difference? 
[246]Oh, I tried. And it made life so much worse for so many innocent predators. 
[247]Is that... Gideon Grey? 
[248]That's really cool, you guys. 
[249]Gideon Grey. I'll be darned. 
[250]Well, I know a thing or two about being a jerk... 
[251]I'm sorry, what did you say? 
[252]A bunny can go savage... 
[253]Night howlers aren't wolves. They're flowers. The flowers are making the predators go savage. That's it! That's what I've been missing! 
[254]Oh, keys! Keys! Keys! Keys! Hurry! Come on! Thank you, I love you bye! 
[255]I need to find Nick. Please. 
[256]Nick? Nick! 
[257]Oh, Nick! Night howlers aren't wolves. They're toxic flowers. I think someone is targeting predators on purpose and making them go savage. 
[258]Wait! Wait, please-- I know you'll never forgive me. And I don't blame you. I wouldn't forgive me either. I was ignorant and irresponsible and small-minded... But predators shouldn't suffer because of my mistakes. I have to fix this, but I can't do it without you. 
[259]And after we're done, you can hate me, and that'll be fine, because I was a horrible friend and I hurt you... and you can walk away knowing you were right all along, I really am just a dumb bunny. 
[260]I'm sorry. 
[261]We are gonna follow the night howlers. 
[262]Know this guy? 
[263]We both know those weren't moldy onions I caught you stealing. What were you gonna do with those night howlers, Wessleton? 
[264]Aw. 
[265]And to whom did you sell them? 
[266]Come on! 
[267]The weasel wasn't lying. 
[268]We need to get this evidence to the 
[269]No. All of it! 
[270]All right. One toot-toot. 
[271]Don't stop! Keep going! 
[272]Do not stop this car! 
[273]Speed up, Nick! Speed up! 
[274]Trust me! SPEED! UP! 
[275]Hey. Need some help? 
[276]Okay... Maybe some of the evidence survived. 
[277]Everything is gone. We've lost it all. 
[278]Oh, Nick! Yes! 
[279]Come on! We gotta get to the ZPD. Cut through the Natural History Museum! 
[280]Oh! There it is! 
[281]Mayor Bellwether! We found out what's happening. Someone's darting predators with a serum-- that's what's making them go savage. 
[282]Thank you, ma'am. How did you know where to find us? 
[283]You know what... I think Nick and I will just take this to the ZPD... 
[284]Ach! 
[285]Pass. 
[286]Take the case. Get it to Bogo. 
[287]I can't walk. 
[288]What are you going to do? Kill me? 
[289]No! Nick?! 
[290]No. Nick, don't do this. Fight it. 
[291]So that's it, prey fears predator, and you stay in power? 
[292]It won't work. 
[293]Oh, Nick! No! 
[294]Blood, blood, blood! And death. 
[295]What you've got in the weapon there- - those are blueberries. From my family's farm. 
[296]Oooo, actually-- 
[297]--It's your word against yours. It's called a hustle, sweetheart. Boom. 
[298]When I was a kid, I thought Zootopia was this perfect place where everyone got along and anyone could be anything... 
[299]Turns out, real life's a little bit more complicated than a slogan on a bumper sticker. Real life is messy. 
[300]We all have limitations. We all make mistakes. Which means-- hey, glass half full!-- we all have a lot in common. And the more we try to understand one another, the more exceptional each of us will be. But we have to try. 
[301]So, no matter what type of animal you are, from the biggest elephant to our first fox... 
[302]I implore you... try. Try to make the world a better place. 
[303]Look inside yourself, and recognize that change starts with you. It starts with me. It starts with all of us. 
[304]Oops. Sorry. 
[305]Dumb fox. 
[306]Do I know that? Yes. Yes, I do. 
[307]Sir, you were going 115 miles per hour. I hope you have a good explanation.
dialogues.NICK:
[1]I'm not looking for any trouble either, sir. I simply want to buy a Jumbo Pop for my little boy. 
[2]You want the red or the blue, pal? 
[3]Uh, no no, there are. There are. It's just, my boy-- --this goofy little stinker-- he loves all things elephant. Wants to be one when he grows up. 
[4]Isn't it adorable? Who the heck am I to crush his little dreams, huh? Right? 
[5]A Jumbo Pop. Please. 
[6]Thank you so much. Thank you. Oh no, are you kidding me? I don't have my wallet. I'd lose my head if it weren't attached to my neck, that's the truth. Oh boy, I'm sorry pal. Gotta be about the worst birthday ever. Please don't be mad at me. Thanks, anyway. 
[7]Officer, I can't thank you enough. So kind, really, can I pay you back? 
[8]Ah, well, that is high praise. It's rare that I find someone so non- patronizing... Officer... 
[9]Wilde. Nick Wilde. 
[10]Ah, boy, I tell him that all the time. All right here ya go-- Two paws. Yeah. Oh, look at that smile, that's a happy birthday smile! All right, give her a little bye-bye toot toot. 
[11]Bye now! 
[12]Pawpsicles! Get your pawpsicles! 
[13]Lumber delivery! 
[14]The color? Uh... It's redwood. 
[15]39...40. There you go. Way to work that diaper, big guy. Hey, no kiss bye-bye for daddy? 
[16]It's called a hustle, sweetheart. And I'm not the liar, he is. 
[17]Really, for what? 
[18]Permit. Receipt of declared commerce. And I didn't falsely advertise anything. Take care. 
[19]That's right. "Red wood." With a space in the middle. Wood that is red. You can't touch me, Carrots, I been doing this since I was born. 
[20]My bad. I just naturally assumed you came from some little carrot- choked podunk, no? 
[21]Okay. Tell me if this story sounds familiar: Naïve little hick with good grades and big ideas decides, "Hey lookit me, I'm gonna move to Zootopia-- where Predators and Prey live in harmony and sing Kumbaya!" Only to find-- whoopsie, we don't all get along. And that dream of becoming a big city cop? Double whoopsie! She's a meter maid. And whoopsie number threesie-- NO ONE cares about her or her dreams. And soon enough those dreams die and our bunny sinks into emotional and literal squalor living in a box under a bridge. Til finally she has no choice but to go back home with that cute, fuzzy wuzzy little tail between her legs to become-- you're from Bunnyburrow, is that what you said?-- so how `bout a carrot farmer... That sound about right? 
[22]Be careful now, it won't just be your dreams getting crushed. 
[23]Alright look, everyone comes to Zootopia thinking they can be anything they want. Well you can't. You can only be what you are. Sly fox. 
[24]Dumb bunny. 
[25]Right. And that's not wet cement. 
[26]You'll never be a real cop. You're a cute meter maid though. Maybe a supervisor one day. Hang in there... 
[27]Hey, it's Officer Toot Toot. 
[28]What happened, meter maid? Did someone steal a traffic cone? It wasn't me. 
[29]Hey, Carrots, you're gonna wake the baby, I gotta get to work. 
[30]I make 200 bucks a day, fluff. 365 days a year, since I was 12, and time is money, hop along. 
[31]I know everybody. And I also know that somewhere there's a toy store missing its stuffed animal, so why don't you get back to your box. 
[32]Did you just boot my stroller? 
[33]For what? Howting your feewings? 
[34]Well, it's my word against yours. 
[35]I don't know where he is. I only saw where he went. 
[36]It's not exactly a place for a cute little bunny. 
[37]Okay. You're the boss. 
[38]Yeah, in Zootopia anyone can be anything. These guys... they be naked. 
[39]Does this make you uncomfortable? Because, if so, there's no shame in calling it quits. 
[40]Boy, that's the spirit. 
[41]Well, I had a ball. You are welcome for the clue. And seeing as how any moron can run a plate, I will take that pen and bid you adieu. 
[42]Give me the pen please. 
[43]Rabbit, I did what you asked, you can't keep me on the hook forever. 
[44]Actually, I just remembered I have a pal at the DMV... 
[45]Flash is the fastest guy in there, you need something done, he's on it. 
[46]What? Are you saying that because he's a sloth, he can't be fast? I thought in Zootopia anyone could be anything. 
[47]Flash, Flash, hundred yard dash! Buddy, it's nice to see ya. 
[48]Hey Flash, I'd love ya to meet my friend-- uh, darlin' I've forgotten your name. 
[49]Hang in there. 
[50]Hey Flash, wanna hear a joke? 
[51]What do you call a three humped camel? 
[52]Pregnant. 
[53]Way to hustle, bud. I love ya. I owe ya. 
[54]Mm. And I will betcha you don't have a warrant to get in. Hm? Darn it. It's a bummer. 
[55]Madam, I have a fake badge. I would never impede your pretend investigation. 
[56]Well then they should have gotten a real cop to find him. 
[57]It does. One hundred percent. Now... since you're sans warrant, I guess we're done? 
[58]Hey! 
[59]First off, you throw like a bunny, second, you're a very sore loser. See ya later, Officer Fluff, so sad this is over, I wish I could've helped more. 
[60]
[61]The Velvety Pipes of Jerry Vole! But on CD? Who still uses CDs? 
[62]Carrots...? If your otter was here... he had a very bad day. 
[63]No. 
[64]Well, now wait a minute... Polar bear fur... Rat Pack music... fancy cup... I know whose car this is. We gotta go! 
[65]The most feared crime boss in Tundratown. They call him Mr. Big and he does not like me, so we gotta go! 
[66]Well, it's gonna be an even bigger crime scene if Mr. Big finds me here, so we're leaving right now! 
[67]Raymond! And, is that Kevin?! Long time no see. And speaking of no see, how about you forget you saw me? Huh? For old time's sake? 
[68]That's a no. 
[69]I uh, I may have sold him a very expensive wool rug... that was made from the fur of a... skunk's butt. 
[70]No. 
[71]No. 
[72]Stop talking stop talking stop talking-- 
[73]Mr. Big, sir, this is a simple misunder- 
[74]This is a simple misunderstanding. 
[75]Well actually we were brought here against our will, so... Point is, I did not know it was your car, and I certainly did not know about your daughter's wedding. 
[76]Mime! She is a mime. This mime, cannot speak. You can't speak if you're a mime. 
[77]Whoa-- I didn't see nothing-- I'm not saying nothing-- 
[78]Please! No no no! If you're mad at me about the rug I've got more rugs! 
[79]Whoa. A teensy otter... did that? 
[80]Oh. So you know about the night howlers too? Good, good, good. Because the night howlers are exactly what we are here to talk about. Right? 
[81]Buddy? 
[82]What is wrong with him?! 
[83]It's Tujunga! 
[84]Get in! Carrots? Carrots! 
[85]No, no, no! 
[86]Buddy, one predator to another--                      * 
[87]Now, I can tell you're a little tense, so I'm just gonna give you a little personal space-- 
[88]Rabbit, whatever you do, do not let go! 
[89]No, you what? No, I said-- listen-- noooo! 
[90]Carrots. You saved my life. 
[91]Uh, no. 
[92]Sorry, what I said was, "no." She will not be giving you that badge. Look, you gave her a clown vest and a three-wheel joke-mobile and two days to solve a case you guys haven't cracked in two weeks? Yeah, no wonder she needed to get help from a fox, none of you guys were gonna help her, were you? 
[93]Here's the thing Chief, you gave her the 48 hours, so technically we still have 10 left to find our Mr. Otterton... and that's exactly what we're gonna do, so if you'll excuse us... we have a very big lead to follow and a case to crack. Good day. 
[94]Officer Hopps? 
[95]Never let `em see that they get to you. 
[96]No... I mean, not anymore. But I was small and emotionally unbalanced like you once. 
[97]No, it's true. I think was 8, or maybe 9, and all I wanted to do was join the Junior Ranger Scouts. 
[98]...so, my mom scraped together enough money to buy me a brand new uniform because, by God, I was gonna fit in. 
[99]Even if I was the only predator in the troop-- 
[100]I was gonna be part of a pack. 
[101]I was so proud. 
[102]I learned two things that day. One, I was never gonna let anyone see that they got to me. 
[103]If the world's only gonna see a fox as shifty and untrustworthy, there's no point in trying to be anything else. 
[104]Boy, look at that traffic down there. How about we go out to Chuck in Traffic Central-- Chuck, how are things looking on the Jam Cams? 
[105]The Jam Cams...! 
[106]No-n-shh-shush! There are traffic cameras everywhere. All over the canopy. Whatever happened to that jaguar-- 
[107]Bingo! 
[108]However. If you didn't have access to the system before, I doubt Chief Buffalo Butt is gonna let you into it now. 
[109]So fluffy! 
[110]Sheep never let me this close. 
[111]You think when she goes to sleep she counts herself? 
[112]Timberwolves. Look at these dumdums. 
[113]Betcha a nickel one of em's gonna howl. 
[114]And there it is. What is it with wolves and the howling? It's like-- 
[115]...I bet they took Otterton too. 
[116]You know, if I wanted to avoid surveillance because I was doing something illegal-- which I never have-- I would use the maintenance tunnel 6B... which would put them out... 
[117]...right there. 
[118]How dare you. 
[119]Acacia alley... Ficus underpass... South Canyon... 
[120]You are a clever bunny. 
[121]You know, after you, you're the cop. 
[122]Okay. All clear. 
[123]Carrots...? 
[124]Yeah. Huge, huge, claw marks. I mean, what kind of-- 
[125]Or not. Guess he's in no rush to get home to the Missus. 
[126]Great! We're dead. We're dead. That's it. I'm dead. You're dead. Everybody's dead. 
[127]What? Can I swim? Yes, I can swim. Why? 
[128]Carrots?! Hopps?! Judy?! 
[129]Okay, press conference 101: You wanna look smart? 
[130]Answer their question with your own question and then answer that question. Like this, "Excuse me. Officer Hopps, what can you tell us about the case?" "Well, was this a tough case? Yes. Yes it was." You see? 
[131]Well, am I a cop? No. No, I am not. 
[132]Oh, I think you said plenty. 
[133]Clearly, there's a biological component? These predators may be reverting back to their primitive, savage ways. Are you serious? 
[134]Right. But a fox could? Huh? 
[135]Oh, there's a them now? 
[136]The kind that needs to be muzzled? The kind that makes you think you need to carry around Fox Repellent? 
[137]Yeah, don't think I didn't notice that little item the first time we met. So let me ask you a question. Are you afraid of me? Do you think I might go nuts? Do you think I might go savage? Do you think I might try to... EAT YOU?! 
[138]...I knew it. Just when I thought somebody actually believed in me... 
[139]Probably best if you don't have a predator as a partner. 
[140]Wow. Isn't that interesting. 
[141]Don't worry, Carrots, I'll let you erase it... in 48 hours. 
[142]Alright, get in here. 
[143]Okay. Oh, you bunnies... You're so emotional. There we go. Deep breath. Are you just trying to steal the pen. Is that what this is? You are standing on my tail, though. Off, off, off. 
[144]I thought you guys only grew carrots. What's the plan? 
[145]Okay. How? 
[146]Uh-huh. I told you, I know everybody. 
[147]Well, well, look who it is. The duke of bootleg. 
[148]Yeah, looks like old Doug's cornered the market on night howlers... 
[149]Hey. Hey! Where are you going? Get back here! What are you doing?! He's gonna see you! What are you looking at? Hey! Whatever you're thinking, stop thinking it. Carrots! Carrots! 
[150]What are you doing?! You just trapped us in here! 
[151]Okay. Great. Here it is. Got it. 
[152]Wait, what? 
[153]Great, you're a conductor now? Hey, listen-- It would take a miracle to get this rust-bucket going. 
[154]Well... Hallelujah! 
[155]Mission accomplished. Would it be premature for me to do a little victory toot-toot? 
[156]Well, I can cross that off the bucket list. 
[157]I may have to rescind that victory toot-toot. 
[158]Maybe that's just hail? 
[159]Back off! 
[160]Incoming! 
[161]Carrots?! 
[162]There's another train coming! 
[163]Oh no! Oh no, no, no! Too fast! Hold on! 
[164]I think this is our stop! 
[165]Yeah. Oh, except for this. 
[166]Ow. 
[167]Ah Carrots! 
[168]I got ya, come here, come here. 
[169]Okay, now just relax. 
[170]Whoops... Blueberry? 
[171]I'm not gonna leave you behind. That's not happening. 
[172]Just, we'll think of something. 
[173]All right, you're milking it. Besides, I think we got it, I think we got it. We got it up there, thank you yakkety-yak-- you laid it all out beautifully. 
[174]Yea, oh, are you looking for the serum? Well, it's right here. 
[175]They are delicious. You should try some. 
[176]Ha! You should have your own line of inspirational greeting cards, sir. 
[177]So are all rabbits bad drivers or is it just you? 
[178]Sly bunny. 
[179]You know you love me. 
[180]Flash? Flash? Hundred yard dash?!
dialogues.BOGO:
[1]All right, all right. Everybody sit. 
[2]I've got three items on the docket. First... we need to acknowledge the elephant in the room. Francine, happy birthday. 
[3]Number two: There are some new recruits with us I should introduce. But I'm not going to, because I don't care. Finally... 
[4]...We have 14 missing mammal cases. All predators, from a giant polar bear, to a teensy little otter. And City Hall is right up my tail to find them. This is priority number one. Assignments! 
[5]Officers Grizzoli, Fangmeyer, Delgato-- your teams take Missing Mammals from the Rainforest District. Officers McHorn, Rhinowitz, Wolfard, your teams take Sahara Square. Officers Higgins, Snarlov, Trunkaby: Tundratown. And finally, our first bunny, Officer Hopps. 
[6]Parking Duty. Dismissed! 
[7]So. 
[8]Didn't forget. Just don't care. 
[9]Well, then writing a hundred tickets a day should be easy. 
[10]
[11]Abandoning your post, inciting a scurry, reckless endangerment of rodents... but to be fair, you did stop a master criminal from stealing two dozen... moldy onions. 
[12]Shut your tiny mouth, now. 
[13]Your job is putting tickets on parked cars. 
[14]Not now. 
[15]Not now! 
[16]Do you think the Mayor asked what I wanted when he assigned you to me? 
[17]Life isn't some cartoon musical where you sing a little song and your insipid dreams magically come true. So let it go! 
[18]Ma'am, as I've told you, we are doing everything we can... 
[19]Yes, I know. 
[20]Ma'am, our detectives are very busy. 
[21]Mrs. Otterton-- 
[22]Mrs. Otterton? Please wait out here. 
[23]One second. 
[24]You're fired. 
[25]Insubordination. Now, I'm going to open this door and you're going to tell that otter you're a former meter maid with delusions of grandeur who will not be taking the case. 
[26]Assistant Mayor Bellwether... 
[27]No! No, let's not tell the mayor just yet-- 
[28]I will give you 48 hours. 
[29]That's two days to find Emmitt Otterton. 
[30]But, you strike out-- you resign. 
[31]Splendid. Clawhauser will give you the complete case file. 
[32]Well, this should be good. 
[33]Savage? This isn't the Stone Age, Hopps. Animals don't go savage. 
[34]The "savage" jaguar. 
[35]Or maybe any aggressive predator looks savage to you rabbits. Let's go. 
[36]You think I'm going to believe a fox? 
[37]Two days to find the otter... 
[38]or you quit... that was the deal. Badge. 
[39]Badge. 
[40]What did you say, fox? 
[41]Not now! 
[42]No! 
[43]Clawhauser, can't you see I'm working on the missing mammal cases?! 
[44]Ladies and Gentlemammals... 14 mammals went missing and all 14 have been found by our newest recruit, who will speak to you in a moment. But first, let me remind you-- 
[45]At twenty-two hundred hours, we found all these missing animals... 
[46]So now, I'll turn things over to the officer who cracked the case. Officer Judy Hopps. 
[47]Come on Hopps. The new Mayor wants to see us. 
[48]It would seem you've arrived. 
[49]Hopps! 
[50]Don't give yourself so much credit, Hopps. The world has always been broken. That's why we need good cops-- like you. 
[51]Hopps. 
[52]All right! All right... 
[53]...Enough! Shut it! We have some new recruits with us this morning, including our first fox. Who cares. 
[54]Shut your mouth, Wilde. Assignments! Officers Grizzoli, Fangmeyer, Delgato: Tundratown Swat. Snarlov, Higgins, Wolfard: Undercover. Hopps, Wilde... Parking duty. Dismissed. Just kidding! We have reports of a street racer tearing up Savannah Central. Find him, shut him down.
dialogues.STU HOPPS:
[1]Judy, you ever wonder how your mom and me got to be so darn happy? 
[2]Well, we gave up on our dreams and we settled, right Bon? 
[3]See, that's the beauty of complacency, Jude. If you don't try anything new, you'll never fail. 
[4]Right. There's never been a bunny cop. 
[5]Bunnies don't do that. 
[6]Never. 
[7]OR... um, heck, you wanna talk about making the world a better place-- 
[8]--no better way to do it than becoming a carrot farmer. 
[9]Yep. 
[10]Amen to that. Carrot farming is a noble profession. 
[11]Ahh, at one with the soil. 
[12]Yeah, just as long as you don't believe in em too much. Where in the heck'd she go? 
[13]There's never been a bunny cop. 
[14]Never. 
[15]Yeah. Scared, too. 
[16]Really, it's kind of a proud-scared combo. I mean, Zootopia. It's so far a away... It's such a big city. 
[17]And also bears. We have bears to fear, too. To say nothing of lions, and wolves... 
[18]...weasels... 
[19]And he cheats like there's no tomorrow. You know what, pretty much all predators-- and Zootopia's full of `em. 
[20]And foxes are the worst. 
[21]Sure. Yeah, we all do. Absolutely. But just in case, we made you a little care package to take with you. 
[22]This is fox deterrent. 
[23]This is fox repellent... 
[24]Check this out! 
[25]Oh c'mon. When is there not a need for a fox taser? 
[26]Terrific! Everyone wins! 
[27]Oh cripes, here come the waterworks. 
[28]Hey there, Jude the Dude! How was your first day on the force? 
[29]Hey, wait a second. Holy cripes, Bonnie! Look at that! 
[30]Ah, she's not a real cop! Our prayers have been answered! 
[31]Meter maid, meter maid! 
[32]Meter maid, meter maid! 
[33]Those meters aren't gonna maid themselves. 
[34]Hey there, Jude-- Jude the dude, remember that one? How we doin? 
[35]Because you're a trier, that's why. 
[36]Oh, not all of them, though. Speak of the devil. Right on time. 
[37]Yep. It sure is. We work with him now. 
[38]That's right. I mean, Gid's turned into one of the top pastry chefs in the tri-burrows. 
[39]Hey kids! Don't you run through that midnicampum holicithias! 
[40]Oh, Gid's talking about those flowers, Judy. I use `em to keep bugs off the produce. But I don't like the little ones going near `em on account of what happened to your Uncle Terry. 
[41]He bit the dickens out of your mother. 
[42]Well sure it did. There's a sizable divot in your arm. I'd call that savage. 
[43]You catch any of that, Bon?
dialogues.BELLWETHER:
[1]Oh! Yes right. 
[2]Congratulations, Officer Hopps. 
[3]Ya know, it's a... It's a real proud day for us little guys. 
[4]I just heard Officer Hopps is taking the case! 
[5]The Mammal Inclusion Initiative is really starting to pay off! Mayor Lionheart is just gonna be so jazzed! 
[6]And I sent it, and it is done, so I did do that. All right, well I'd say the case is in good hands! Us little guys really need to stick together! Right? 
[7]Good one! Just call me if you ever need anything, okay? You've always got a friend at City Hall, Judy. Alright, bye bye! 
[8]Sir? If we could just review these very important-- Sir? 
[9]Ooo, I'm so sorry... sir?! 
[10]No, no! But, sir, you do have a meeting with Herds and Grazing... sir, if I could just-- 
[11]Oh, mutton chops. 
[12]Where to? 
[13]There! Traffic cams for the whole city. This is so exciting, actually. Well, you know, I never get to do anything this important. 
[14]Oh, I'm more of a glorified secretary. I think Mayor Lionheart just wanted the sheep vote... But he did give me that nice mug. 
[15]Feels good to be appreciated. 
[16]That's a fun little name he likes to use. I called him Lionfart once. He did not care for that, let me tell you. It was not a good day for me. Yes, sir? 
[17]Oh, dear. I better go -- Let me know what you find. It was really nice for me to be-- 
[18]Officer Hopps, it's time. 
[19]Okay, thank you Officer Hopps, uh, that's all the time that we have. No more questions... 
[20]Oh, you did fine. 
[21]Our city is 90% prey, Judy. And right now they're just really scared. You're a hero to them. They trust you. And so that's why Chief Bogo and I want you to be the public face of the ZPD. 
[22]Judy, you've worked so hard to get here. It's what you've wanted since you were a kid. You can't quit... 
[23]Judy! Judy! 
[24]I am so proud of you, Judy. You did just a super job. 
[25]I'll go ahead and I'll take that case now. 
[26]Get them! 
[27]Come on out, Judy! 
[28]We're on the same team, Judy! 
[29]Underestimated. Under-appreciated. Aren't you sick of it? Predators. They may be strong and loud, but prey out-number predators 10 to one. 
[30]Think of it-- 90 percent of the population, united against a common enemy. We'll be unstoppable. 
[31]Over there! 
[32]Well, you should have stayed on the carrot farm, huh? It really is too bad; I really did like you. 
[33]No! Of course not... he is. 
[34]Yes, police! There's a savage fox in the natural history museum. Officer Hopps is down! Please hurry! 
[35]Oh, but he can't help it, can he? Since preds are just biologically predisposed to be savages. 
[36]Gosh, think of the headline: "Hero Cop Killed By Savage Fox..." 
[37]Yeah, pretty much. 
[38]Fear always works. And I'll dart every predator in Zootopia to keep it that way. 
[39]Bye-Bye, Bunny. 
[40]What? 
[41]I framed Lionheart, I can frame you too! It's my word against yours! 
[42]And I'll dart every predator in Zootopia to keep it that way...
dialogues.BONNIE HOPPS:
[1]Oh yes, that's right, Stu. We settled hard. 
[2]What your father means, hon, is it's gonna be difficult-- impossible even-- for you to become a police officer. 
[3]No. 
[4]Never. 
[5]Yes! Your dad, me, your 275 brothers and sisters-- we're changing the world. 
[6]One carrot at a time... 
[7]Mmm hmm. Just putting the seeds in the ground. 
[8]You get it. I mean, it's great to have dreams. 
[9]Never. 
[10]We're real proud of you, Judy. 
[11]Yes. 
[12]We know. And we're just a little excited for you, but terrified. 
[13]Wolves? 
[14]You play cribbage with a weasel. 
[15]Oh, Stu. 
[16]Actually, your father does have a point there. It's in their biology. Remember what happened with Gideon Grey. 
[17]And I put some snacks in there. 
[18]Yeah that's safe to have there. 
[19]Okay, the deterrent and the repellent. That's all she needs. 
[20]Oh for goodness sake. She has no need for a fox taser, Stu. 
[21]Love you, too! 
[22]Oh Stu, pull it together. 
[23]Aw there she is! Hi sweetheart! 
[24]Yeah? Everything you ever hoped? 
[25]Oh my sweet heaven-- Judy, are you a meter maid? 
[26]It's the safest job on the force! 
[27]Glorious day! 
[28]That's right. You get some rest! 
[29]Bye bye! 
[30]You are not fine. Your ears are droopy. 
[31]You've always been a trier. 
[32]He's our partner. And we never would have considered it had you not opened our minds. 
[33]Yeah, Terry ate one whole when we were kids and went completely nuts. 
[34]Savage? Well, that's a strong word. But it did hurt like the devil. 
[35]Not one bit.
dialogues.FLASH:
[1]Nice to... see you... too. 
[2]I am... doing... just... 
[3]...as well... as... I can... be. What... 
[4]...can I... do... 
[5]For you... 
[6]...today. 
[7]Sure.    What's the... plate... 
[8]...Number? 
[9]2... 9... 
[10]
[11]
[12]
[13]0. 
[14]Sure. 
[15]I don't... know... What... do... you call... a... 
[16]Three humped... camel? 
[17]Ha... ha... ha... ha... 
[18]Hey... Priscilla... 
[19]What... do... 
[20]You call... a... 
[21]Three... humped... 
[22]Here... 
[23]You... go. 
[24]Nick.
dialogues.CLAWHAUSER:
[1]O-M goodness! They really did hire a bunny. What?! 
[2]I gotta tell ya, you are even cuter than I thought you'd be. 
[3]I am so sorry. Me, Benjamin Clawhauser, the guy everyone thinks is just a flabby, donut-loving cop, stereotyping you...? 
[4]Oh, there you went, you little dickens! 
[5]Oh! Bullpen's over there to the left. 
[6]Aw... That poor little bunny's gonna get eaten alive. 
[7]Okay, you're gonna have to be patient and wait in line just like everyone else, Mrs. Otterton, okay? 
[8]Chief, uh, Mrs. Otterton's here to see you again. 
[9]Okay, I just didn't know if you wanted to take it this time, she seems really upset-- 
[10]I'm sorry, sir, I tried to stop her, she is super slippery. I gotta go sit down. 
[11]Here ya go! One missing otter! 
[12]Yikes! That is the smallest case file I've ever seen! Leads: none, witnesses: none-- and you're not in the computer system yet, so resources: none. I hope you didn't stake your career on cracking this one. 
[13]The murder weapon! 
[14]Yeah, `cause that... What does that mean? 
[15]Are you familiar with Gazelle? Greatest singer of our lifetime-- angel with horns-- okay, hold on, keep watching. Who's that beside her? Who is it? 
[16]It's me! Did you think it was real? It looks so real! It's not. It's just a new app. Hold on a second-- 
[17]Okay, we're sending back up! Hopps? 
[18]Chief Bogo! 
[19]Wait, is that Gazelle? 
[20]You have the app too?! Oh, jeeeeez! 
[21]Oh, yes of course! About that, sir... Officer Hopps just called... She found all of `em. 
[22]Um, they thought it would be better if a predator such as myself wasn't the first face you that you see when you walk into the ZPD. 
[23]They're gonna move me to Records. It's downstairs. By the boiler.
dialogues.YOUNG JUDY:
[1]Fear. Treachery. Bloodlust! Thousands of years ago, these were the forces that ruled our world. A world where prey were scared of predators. And predators had an uncontrollable biological urge to maim and maul and... 
[2]Blood, blood, blood! 
[3]And death. 
[4]Back then, the world was divided in two. Vicious predator or Meek prey. 
[5]Now, predator and prey live in harmony. 
[6]And every young mammal has multitudinous opportunities. 
[7]And I can make the world a better place! I am going to be... 
[8]A police officer! 
[9]It may seem impossible to small minds-- I'm looking at you Gideon Grey. 
[10]But just 211 miles away stands the great city of Zootopia! Where our ancestors first joined together in peace, and declared that anyone can be anything! Thank you and good night! 
[11]Nope. 
[12]I like trying, actually. 
[13]Oh. Then I guess I'll have to be the first one. Because I am gonna make the world... A better place! 
[14]Hey! 
[15]You heard her. Cut it out. 
[16]Kindly return my friends' tickets. 
[17]You don't scare me, Gideon. 
[18]Yeah... Yeah, I'm okay. 
[19]Here you go. 
[20]Well, he was right about one thing... 
[21]I don't know when to quit.
dialogues.LIONHEART:
[1]As Mayor of Zootopia, I am proud to announce that my Mammal Inclusion Initiative has produced its first police academy graduate. 
[2]Valedictorian of her class, ZPD's very first rabbit officer... Judy Hopps. 
[3]Assistant Mayor Bellwether? Her badge. 
[4]Thank you. 
[5]Judy, it is my great privilege to officially assign you to the heart of Zootopia: Precinct One, City Center. 
[6]Bellwether, make room will ya? Come on. 
[7]Okay, Officer Hopps. Let's see those teeth! 
[8]Okay. I heard you, Bellwether. Just take care of it! Please. And clear my afternoon, I'm going out. 
[9]Smellwether?! 
[10]I thought you were going to cancel my afternoon?! 
[11]While we're young, Smellwether! 
[12]Enough! I don't want excuses, Doctor, I want answers. 
[13]Really? Cuz I got a dozen and a half animals here who've gone off the rails crazy-- and you can't tell me why. Now, I'd call that awfully far from doing everything. 
[14]What? What do you mean biology? 
[15]Hmm... Great idea. Tell the public. And how do you think they're gonna feel about their mayor, who is a lion?! I'll be ruined! 
[16]Chief Bogo doesn't know. And we are going to keep it that way. 
[17]Someone's here! 
[18]You don't understand. I was trying to protect the city. 
[19]No. Listen, we still don't know why this is happening. It could destroy Zootopia. 
[20]Did I falsely imprison those animals? Well, yes. Yes I did. It was a classic "doing the wrong thing for the right reason" kind of a deal.
dialogues.DUKE WEASELTON:
[1]Catch me if you can, Cottontail! 
[2]Whoa. Coming through! 
[3]Bon voyage, flat foot! 
[4]Have a donut, coppah! 
[5]Come to papa... 
[6]Well, hello, step right up! Anything you need... I got it. All your favorite movies! I got movies that haven't even been released yet! 
[7]Hey, 15% off! 20! Make me an offer! Come on! 
[8]What's it to you, Wilde? Shouldn't you be melting down a popsicle or something? Hey, if it isn't Flopsy the Copsy. 
[9]It's Weaselton. Duke Weaselton. And I ain't talking, rabbit. And ain't nothing you can do to make me. 
[10]Aaagh! Agh! Ya dirty rat! Why ya helping her?! She's a cop! 
[11]All right, all right, please! I'll talk! I'll talk. I stole them night howlers so I could sell `em. They offered me what I couldn't refuse... Money. 
[12]A ram named Doug. We got a drop spot underground... 
[13]...Just watch it. Doug is the opposite of friendly. He's unfriendly...
dialogues.GIDEON GREY:
[1]Bunny cop. That is the most stupidest thing I ever heard. 
[2]Gimme your tickets right now, or I'm gonna kick your meek little sheep butt. 
[3]Baa-baa. What're ya gonna do, cry? 
[4]Nice costume, loser. What crazy world are you living in where you think a bunny could be a cop? 
[5]Come and get `em.... But watch out, `cause I'm a fox-- and like you said in your dumb little stage play, us predators used to eat prey. And that killer instinct's still in our Dunnahh. 
[6]Don't tell me what I know, Travis. 
[7]You scared now? 
[8]Cry little baby bunny. Cry, cry -- 
[9]Oh, you don't know when to quit, do ya? 
[10]I want you to remember this moment-- the next time you think you will ever be anything more than just a stupid, carrot farming dumb bunny. 
[11]Just a stupid, carrot farming dumb bunny. 
[12]Well, that makes me feel a little better. I thought she was talking in tongues or something.
dialogues.JUDY:
[1]I won't let you down. This has been my dream since I was a kid. 
[2]Guys-- I've been working for this my whole life. 
[3]The only thing we have to fear is fear itself. 
[4]When I was 9. Gideon Grey was a jerk, who happened to be a fox. I know plenty of bunnies who are jerks. 
[5]Okay, look-- I will take this to make you stop talking. 
[6]OK. Gotta go. Bye! 
[7]I love you guys. 
[8]Bye everybody! 
[9]Bye! 
[10]He's an otter actually.
dialogues.GAZELLE:
[1]I am Gazelle. Welcome to Zootopia! 
[2]Wow, you are one hot dancer... 
[3]Wow, you are one hot dancer... 
[4]I am Gazelle, and you are one hot dancer. 
[5]Wow! I'm impressed. 
[6]Zootopia is a unique place. It's a crazy, beautiful, diverse city where we celebrate our differences. This is not the Zootopia I know. 
[7]The Zootopia I know is better than this. 
[8]...but it is irresponsible to label all predators as savages. 
[9]We cannot let fear divide us. Please-- give me back the Zootopia I love...
dialogues.FRU FRU SHREW:
[1]Ohmygawd, did you see those leopard print jeggings? Aaaaaaaaaaaagh! 
[2]Aw... thank you. 
[3]Oh, Daddy, it's time for our dance. What did we say? No icing anyone at my wedding! 
[4]Wait. WAIT! She's the bunny that saved my life yesterday. From that giant donut. 
[5]Yeah. Hi! 
[6]Aw, thank you. 
[7]I'm gonna name her Judy.
dialogues.YAX THE HIPPIE YAK:
[1]Oooooooooohmmmmmmmm. Oooooooooooohmmmmmm. 
[2]Ooo, you know, I'm gonna hit the pause button right there, `cause we're all good on Bunny Scout Cookies. 
[3]
[4]Huh? Oh for sure, we're a naturalist club. 
[5]Nangi's just on the other side of the pleasure pool. 
[6]Yeah, some mammals say the naturalist life is weird, but you know what I say is weird? Clothes on animals! Here we go. 
[7]As you can see, Nangi's an elephant, so she'll totally remember everything. Hey Nangi, these dudes have some questions about Emmitt the Otter.
dialogues.MAJOR FRIEDKIN:
[1]Listen up Cadets! Zootopia has 12 unique ecosystems within its city limits-- Tundra Town, Sahara Square, Rainforest District, to name a few. You're gonna have to master all of them before you hit the streets-- or guess what? You'll be dead! 
[2]Scorching sandstorm. You're dead, bunny bumpkin! 
[3]Frigid ice wall. You're dead, farm girl! 
[4]E-normous criminal. 
[5]You're dead! 
[6]Filthy toilet. You're dead, fluff butt!
dialogues.ORYX POOTOSSER:
[1]Don't expect us to apologize for it. 
[2]You shut up! 
[3]Hey Bunny! Turn down that depressing music! 
[4]Oh, shut up! 
[5]You shut up! 
[6]Yeah, but it might be worse!
dialogues.YAX:
[1]Uh, Emmitt Otterton? Been coming to your yoga class for like 6 years? 
[2]He was here a couple Wednesdays ago. `Member? 
[3]Yeah, he was wearing a green cable- knit sweater vest, and new pair of corduroy slacks. Oh, and a paisley tie. Sweet Windsor knot. Real tight. Remember that Nangi? 
[4]Yeah, and we both walked him out and he got into this big ol' white car with a silver trim? Needed a tune up. The third cylinder wasn't firing. `Member that, Nangi? 
[5]Oh, for sure. It was 29THD03. 
[6]Told ya Nangi has a mind like a steel trap. I wish I had a memory like an elephant.
dialogues.MEAN KID ANIMAL:
[1]Okay, Nick! 
[2]Ready for initiation? 
[3]Okay. Now raise your right hand and deliver the oath. 
[4]Even though you're a fox? 
[5]If you thought we would ever trust a fox without a muzzle, you're even dumber than you look. 
[6]Aw, is he gonna cry.
dialogues.DOUG:
[1]You got Doug here. What's the mark? Cheetah in Sahara Square. Got it. 
[2]Serious? Yeah, I know they're fast. I can hit him. Listen, I hit a tiny little otter through the open window of a moving car. 
[3]Yeah I'll buzz you when it's done. Or you'll see it on the news. Ya know, whichever comes first. 
[4]Alright, Woolter and Jesse are back, so I'm leaving now. Out. 
[5]It better have the extra foam this time-- 
[6]We kinda got a situation at the lab... Oh! It just got worse!
